line_1: The Soldier too, whom nought but thee can scare,
line_2: In Hopes of Plunder, bravely meets the War;

line_1: Stella! if Walpole's spectres thus can scare,
line_2: He'll surely conjure many a spirit there,

line_1: As might the crows in Autumn scare.
line_2: From which hung down such stiff, lank hair,

line_1: Be still, ye Aspin Boughs, nor restless scare,
line_2: With busy trembling Leaves, the list'ning Hare;
